values:
Hey.

This is very belated, but I've been running like mad ever since fall break.

Over fall break, my parents sold the dealership.

I have been intending to send a ginormous mass email, but haven't found the motivation yet.

Pass it on.

I'm really going to miss Willa on Dancing with the Stars!

How ironic that the week Tia Carrere comes to watch Dancing is the week that her former partner, Maksim, is voted off?

:-[

I want Maks to teach me how to dance...and I want him an Willa to be an item, because that would be so cute!

In more personal news, I cannot wait to go home, even though I'm not sure where I'll be sleeping!  Both of my dad's sisters and their husbands are in town for my Granny's 90th birthday party on Friday!  I can't wait to just be with my parents and Chris, though, and be slow and in my element.

I started the heel [maybe, perhaps, although it really doesn't look right yet] on the first sock that I'm knitting.  It's pretty intimidating but fun.

P.S. I finally finally FINALLY got a gay? fine by me. t-shirt today!  My wardrobe is complete!

Way to go, UGA. I think that putting some stress on a college coach's job security is a lot better option than turning away 41 kids who are legitimately seeking an education [averaged about 30 from the football team, 11 from the basketball team]. RADIO EDIT: I am seriously so happy, there are so many exciting things about to happen in the next couple of weeks!!!! 1- I registered for Homecoming weekend, so ignore the fact that I live on campus and am taking 4 classes here, I'm a young alumni! 2- I have ALREADY started to see people that I love...Stacey is the first of many [I hope] this weekend! 3- I'm actually going to recognize people around campus this weekend, hooray! 4- We're closing down on the weeks from hell [re: school work]! 5- SECRETARY OF STATE RICE! 6- BEING ABLE TO APPLY TO MEET HER IN AN INTIMATE PRE-LECTURE GET-TOGETHER THROUGH MY CAPSTONE! OMG!!!!! 7- Going home for a long Fall Break weekend! 8- My Granny's 90th birthday party next Friday! 9- The first opera of the season in Pittsburgh next Saturday...Pagliacci! 10- Getting all snazzed up to go out on the town with that gorgeous man! 11- My parents' stress finally being lifted SOON! 12- Being able to celebrate sanity with my parents! So, I'd say all-in-all I am a pretty psyched little girl over here...HOORAY HOORAY!

Dude, does anyone know how to make a sweet-looking toga?  I'm going to my first-ever toga party this weekend at Mercyhurst [who would have thought this tiny Catholic school would have toga parties?!]...

BIG TIME shout out to Rhian for being such a damn good sport in political theory yesterday!  CHOMP!

I started learning how to knit my very first sock tonight!

I'm exhausted from this week and it's only Tuesday!

On 80 this evening I was listening to "Big Yellow Taxi" by Joni Mitchell.  In the very short duration of the song, I just happened to be passed by a big yellow Hummer going about 90 mph.  Is this only funny to me?

P.S. - Grr, sometimes the Steelers make it hard to love them.

The leaves are just starting to change color along Route 80 in Central PA, from Brookeville to Lewisburg.  Acres of green have a subtle blush, freckles of vibrant reds and burnt-oranges.

Who'd have ever thought that I would turn out to be a "hunting camp" kind of girl?

May today there be peace within. May you trust God that you are exactly where you are meant to be. May you not forget the infinite possibilities that are born of faith. May you use those gifts that you have received, and pass on the love that has been given to you. May you be content knowing you are a child of God. Let this presence settle into your bones, and allow your soul the freedom to sing, dance, praise and love. It is there for each and every one of you.

I don't even know why I tried to stay away...I need all of the procrastination tools I can get my hands on!  That, and friends.

Quick little update:  I'm back at Bucknell to finish out the year that I lost.  It is strange and people look at me weird and I have like 5 friends, but I've done more homework in the past 2 1/2 weeks than ever before in my entire college career.  That might be an eggageration, but still I'm gonna get some freaking sweet grades!

I don't know how well I'll be able to peruse all of your entries that I've missed, but I'll do my darndest.  I hope you are all well, and your presences are missed by this girl.

Just a few things...

Thanks to my gorgeous friends for the lovely spring-time flowers they sent last week [?] / a few weeks ago [?]; what a wonderful thing to wake up to!  Not the fat scary flower-delivery man, but the huge aromatic flush of buds that are still in my family room.  I think they need water.

Thanks to my newly-bearded [?] Crunchy friend Will for the terrific note he sent to me!  It was so thoughtful and really made my day!  BJ, I immediately wrote back, but didn't get the chance to actually send my reply until Saturday, just FYI.

My terrific boyfriend came home on Wednesday for spring break, and he's home until the end of the week!  I am so glad!  Already we have spent almost no time apart [save for sleeping time and today when he fixed his car], and it's been so wonderful!  Probably the best part was that he took me to a pet store yesterday and we got to play with the sweetest puppy in the world!  [2 month old, female, light beige cocker spaniel...I named her Lady]  I was so glad they had the playrooms, and we spent about 30 minutes watching her run around like crazy and biting anything she could get her teeth on.  She peed on me, too.  It was great!  Afterwards, my leg didn't even hurt, which brings the conclusion that I need a puppy to love!

My first visit with Dr. Whiting, the neurosurgeon that is going to do the spinal cord stimulator implant is March 14th.  I can't wait.  Then, it'll be 1-3 weeks until I can have the operation and start recovering and physical therapy-ing!  Hooray!

Yay Steelers...way to pull it off while still playing [offense] like second-string high schoolers. I feel badly for Ben, he was not anywhere close to being as prolific as he was the past 3 games, but he had a number of clutch runs and that block for the reverse/El pass/Ward reception was a beaut. I can't sleep even though I am exhausted. Tomorrow I am having the trial spinal cord stimulator [or neurostimulator] put in and am, all of a sudden, just terrified. Aparently they use a hollow 10- [or less] gauge needle to insert the electronic leads into my spinal cord; all I can think about is, "what if I have a spasm and the needle slips inside the spinal column, and then...*poof*?" I hate this. Every now and then I just get inconsolably nervous, or scared, or down, and I can't pick it up. I'm sick of being in so much constant and dibilitating pain, but why do I have to deal with these huge risks -- I mean, they're going to be INSIDE MY SPINE! -- just to get some relief? Beth reminded me tonight that everything happens for a reason, and I believe that, although I am terrified of what I might lose [and never be able to get back] in the grand scheme of things.

Giving Seattle the Needle by Rick Reilly [of Sports Illustrated, 2/6/2006] -Okay, Seattle, grab a grande, skinny, no-foam, half-caf Espresso Macchiato and let me explain why the Pittsburgh Steelers are going to grind you up like a Sumatra blend in SuperBowl XL. -You suck at sports. -You always have. You make nice motherboards, but you're dweebier than Frasier Crane's wine club. You've had the big three pro sports for 30 years now -- almost 40 for the NBA -- and you have one lousy championship to show for it. Uno. The 1978 Seattle SuperSonics. My God, you people have fewer parades than Venice. -What's amazing is, you do college sports even worse. In the 70 years that a mythical national championship has been awarded in college football, the University of Washington has one half of one title: in 1991 (with Miami). Zippo in basketball, baseball, track or field. OK, the Huskies are good at crew (three women's titles, one men's). Wonderful. Somewhere, three salmon cheer. -Your most famous athlete is a horse, Seattle Slew. Your most famous athletic moment was Bo Jackson's turing the Boz's chest into a welcome mat on Monday Night Football. Your greatest contribution to sports was the Wave, the fan-participation stunt that screams to the world, "We have no idea what the score is!" -And do you know why you stink, Seattle? Because... 1. You're too damn nice. -Look at your Seahawks. Your MVP halfback, Shaun Alexander, teaches kids chess. Your scariest player is named Pork Chop. My God, last week, you offered valet parking service to reporters at Seahawks headquarters. (Seattle fans: If you see valet parking at Detroit's Ford Field this week, they're trying to steal your car.) -Nearly every five-dollar-steak-tough athlete who comes to Seattle leaves -- Gary Payton and Randy Johnson for instance. Consider Seattle's two favorite athletes -- Steve Largent and Fred Couples. Those guys wouldn't complain if somebody extinguished a Cohiba in their ears. Your sportswriters are more forgiving than Hillary Clinton. If they covered Jeffrey Dahmer, they'd refer to him as "a people person." -You Seattle fans don't just accept mediocrity. You crave it. You support your boys come hell or low water. You show up at the rate of three million a year for the Mariners, who never fail to let you down. Even the stadium sounds cuddly: Safeco Field. You pack the house for the underachieving SuperSonics, led by the NBA's nicest loser, Ray Allen. Your Seahawks went 21 years without a playoff win, and the fans didn't so much as clear their throats. Everybody just goes, "Well, that was fun. Let's kayak!" Hey, you can't spell Seattle without settle. -The whole town is 100% June Cleaver. I once walked into a Nordstrom, the Seattle-based department store, and sheepishly asked if I could bring back a shirt I'd bought a month before in another town. The clerk said, "Sir, this is Nordstrom. You could wear it for 10 years, throw up on it and roll down a mountain in it and we'd take it back." Ask that at Neiman Marcus and they call security. -It ain't happening. Walruses don't do triple Salchows, and Seattle teams don't win titles. 2. You're too damn geeky. -Your owner, Microsoft cofounder Paul Allen, looks like the kid in high school who always got taped to the goalposts. If Allen wins, will he call all his friends from band camp? Throw his slide rule into the air? Plot his joy on a scatter chart? -Look, your average Seahawks fan drives a Prius. Your average Steelers fan drives a Ford Excursion, which has Priuses in its tire treads. Seahawks fans own poodles. Steelers fans eat them. 3. You're too damn wet. -Seattle is a great place if you happen to be mold. It just rained 27 straight days and it wasn't even a record. Seattle is basically a lot of guys waiting for a bus with rain starting to seep into their socks. Most kids are seven years old before they realize the ubrella is not an extension of the right arm. No wonder most great athletes leave. Ken Griffy Jr. left, basically saying, "I want my kid to be able to play outside once in a while." -In short, you people are too damn peaceful and happy in your Emerald City. You ever know anybody from Pittsburgh? You want this SuperBowl. Pittsburgh needs it. You're going to get smoked like a platter of smelt. -(But do you mind if we come live there?) I thought it essential to advertise Ben Roethlisburger's blog on here...my favorite part is the pictures of him at the Civic/Mellon Arena when WWE came through because he and Max Starks went together [and I think Max Starks may just have one of the cutest personalities on the Steelers]!

Yesterday I went through a football withdrawal...a Sunday just isn't a Sunday without a Steelers game, I think. That's the toughest and worst part about going to SuperBowl EXTRA-LARRRRGE, that yesterday there was nothing to watch on TV until the 11:00 news. But I guess it's OK because I finished Sherlock Holmes, started and finished The 10 People You Meet in Heaven, AND I pulled some Steelers stuff from the back of my closet...literally! I found my 1995 Conference Champions t-shirt, from the team that went to [and lost, thanks Neil O'Donnell] the last Steelers' SuperBowl [XXX]. It's the t-shirt that I took with me to Saint Vincent College at the Steelers' training camp the summer before 7th grade. I just want to document the signatures on that holy shirt... Bill Cowher, Coach, [92-present] Josh Miller, #4, P, [96-03] -- twice! oops! I was a boy-crazy 12-year-old and he was a super-cute pro football player! Chris Oldham, #24, CB, [95-99] Carnell Lake, #37, SS, [89-98] -- I tracked him down outside of the cafeteria, running after him in his Speedo sandals, after I hunted down Coach Cowher Carlos Emmons, #51, LB, [96-99] -- perhaps known from his gun? knife? fight before the preseason of 1996 John Jackson, #65, [88-97] -- practice team, perhaps? can't find anything on him Jim Sweeney, #66, C/G, [96-99] Will Wolford, #77, G/T, [96-98] Charles Johnson, #81, WR, [94-98] I showed it to Chris and he was pretty excited/impressed. The bad part is that I can't find the photo album from my disposable camera, with which I took an entire roll of pictures, including one of Greg Lloyd passing by everyone! I wanted his autograph probably the most, as he was my FAVORITE player and I was wearing his jersey, but he's also a bad-ass, so a picture is about as close as I was gonna get. Haha, that was a great father-daughter outing and a great memory! PLUS, I forgot to write, that my aunt & her boyfriend [who is the CEO of the Nat'l Epileptic Foundation, I think] sent me a copy of Epilepsy USA in the mail. Alan Faneca was on the cover [he is an epileptic, I learned, since he was 15], and IT WAS SIGNED BY OUR PRO-BOWL O-LINEMAN!!!! Holy crap, it was so exciting. OK, that's it! I promise! WOOT, GO STEELERS!
I think that maybe School of Rock is my favorite movie ever...CELLOOOO!!!

Well last night I tried to actually do something to figure out what is going on in you, my dear friends', lives, so I read my friends' page. [And sorry for all the retroactive comments, Will, but yours were the only entries I didn't feel bashful or awkward about commenting so past the READ-BY date.] I found that after I read all of your great, witty, emotional, intelligent, etc., etc., etc., entries I got pretty depressed. [I would like to preface this statement by noting that it is NOT meant to offend any of you, it is just a reflection of my current life and that I am supremely jealous!] I was depressed because I can remember when normal things made me worried; when things like classes, homework, and trying to find a job stressed me out; when the alternating good and bad of being at Bucknell and the people who live there actually mattered to me. I was depressed because the new worries and stressors in my life tend more to whether I will ever walk again, what am I going to do with a permanent/pacemaker-like implant inside of my body for the rest of my life, or what happens if this spinal cord stimulator -- this ABSOLUTELY last resort trial -- DOESN'T work? I was depressed because so many of you are looking forward to your last semester at Bucknell, finding a way OUT, creating your new life, and walking on your own path. I was depressed because I get to stick around for another glorious year in Lewisburg IF I can get healthy again, I will be nearly all alone once [the majority of those who are seniors] my friends graduate and move on, and in addition to MORE undergraduate school I have MONTHS of physical therapy ahead of me to look forward to. I was depressed because you all are living blissfully normal lives, while I'm stuck on the couch for my THIRD semester of college, waiting for doctors to put electronic devices into the cushioning of my ass and hooking them up into my spine. The biggest difference is, however, that I try to greet every day with respect, admiration, and love...the thrill of being alive [even through the pain] sometimes squeezes so strong on my heart during my nightly prayer of thanks that I can't simply relay it in words or thoughts but rather in tears...I've adapted a joie de vivre that I can neither satiate nor be misplaced by sitting on the couch. Please, my friends, I hope for all of you to see the beauty in the common life, in the dark stormclouds that beget the virgin snow, in the people you choose to surround yourself with, the warmth of your own body and your fragile health. I know that it can sometimes be unavoidable, but don't spend your life worrying, nervous, or sad; go out and greet your friends with the same vigor, PROCRASTINATE your work to do something fabulous like taking a walk in a thunderstorm or sleeping on the quad, and don't be affraid of laughing at yourself [and especially at others!]. I'm sorry that I have to give up reading your entries for another period of time, but I DON'T forget to pray for your health and happiness. Please try to make a difference by starting with yourself: Is it so hard to ask for the glass to be half-full? Laugh daily...and maybe one time when you do, you will think of me.

Wow, everything on LJ has changed since my last installment... I just wanted to make sure it stayed active and to say HERE WE GO STEELERS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I hope everyone is doing really well at the start of a new year and a new semester! Stay safe, don't get too stressed, and live it up to the fullest! I miss everyone, even just seeing people around, but I'm hanging in there at home. Hey, for those of you who aren't about to graduate, at least I'll be able to see you at school in the coming year!! RAWK --clangsto

Haven't gotten so many A's in one week since middle school, mayhaps. Rawk. Am exhausted; want to go to senior night, but don't think my leg and/or shoulders can take it. Need to get out of here [my room]. Am going stir crazy. yuck edit [9:00 p.m.]

FUUUUUCK! SOMEONE PLEASE MAKE THE PAIN GO AWAY!!!

I am back at school.  
Still pain, but now I have los drogas for that.  
I got my digital camera back, which means Buffett photos.
My leg hurts.  
I hate anesthesia when it doesn't work.  
I love my parents.  
I am going to take my first nap of the day now.

Update [not like anyone really cares, I just like to keep track of this shit for myself] : Ankle = sprained one of the x-ray angles showed that a tendon [ligament?] pulled off a chip of bone from one of my metatarsals so ankle really = broken, but oh well RSD ensued getting lumbar injection on Thursday morning that is all

Ugh.

I have been trying to avoid this, but I am too frustrated not to anymore.

That doesn't make sense.

I am in pain again.  Fuck.  Fuck fuck fuck.  This time it's in my ankle, which I sprained by jogging on it funny at a gas station on Tuesday on my way home from Mercyhurst.  But once it existed in my ankle, my knee started to hurt again, too.  But, gee, I can't put on my knee brace because one fourth of it goes AROUND MY ANKLE.  However, I can't wear my boot for the ankle because it'd be too much stress ON MY KNEE!  And now, from limping all over my Gateway, the BURSITIS in my HIP has started to flame up.

FUCK!!!!

I have no idea what to do.  I don't want to use the crutches again, that's such bullshit.

<lj-cut text="motherfucker...">
So in searching for some relief to the pain on the RSD Hope website, I came across this:

"At home, Dorthy logged on to her computer to learn all she could. Everything she discovered convinced her that Allison did have RSD, a little-known and often misdiagnosed neurological condition that causes nerves to misfire and send constant pain signals to the brain.

Through organizations like the Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy Syndrome Association, Dorthy learned that RSD often follows a minor injury. The disease is not fatal, but it is considered the worst of any chronic pain disorder.

There is no cure. Treated early, usually with medication and nerve blocks, remission is possible. Without proper treatment, RSD renders most patients disabled. There is no single test to diagnose RSD. Most doctors never have encountered it, and many are skeptical that it even exists."

That hits home so much.  Fuck.  My leg temperatures are definitely different, Monica just confirmed it.  I'm sick of nothing helping.  UGH!</lj-cut>

More Emotional


You have:
70% SCIENTIFIC INTUITION and
85% EMOTIONAL INTUITION
The graph on the right represents your place in Intuition 2-Space. As you can see, you scored well above average on emotional intuition and above average on scientific intuition.Your emotional intuition is stronger than your scientific intuition.

Your Emotional Intuition score is a measure of how well you understand people, especially their unspoken needs and sympathies. A high score score usually indicates social grace and persuasiveness. A low score usually means you're good at Quake.

Your Scientific Intuition score tells you how in tune you are with the world around you; how well you understand your physical and intellectual environment. People with high scores here are apt to succeed in business and, of course, the sciences.

It rules.

You scored higher than 95% on Interpersonal
Link: The 2-Variable Intuition Test written by jason_bateman on OkCupid Free Online Dating, home of the 32-Type Dating Test

After spewing so much animosity towards Bucknell so far this semester, something happened today that made me realize just how much I do love it in actuality...

...two of the phys plant and/or support staff guys who work near the Trax/Roberts parking lot area very much of the time [at least they did for the past 2 years when I lived there] were driving past me [walking on the road, near Hunt] in a pickup.  Both of them gave me full-arm-extension, out-of-the-window waves, and it made my day that they still remember me.  It also makes me glad that I waited until I didn't live in Trax to quit smoking because that was such an awesome feeling.

Now if only the student population at Bucknell would catch up to the employee population in terms of friendliness we'd have it made.
I just google image searched my parents' dealership and got this picture... It looks so weird and bare-nekkid w/o all of the cars on the lot. PS...www.iwannabesedated.com is a true website. Wow

This class is probably the most ridiculous one I have ever taken here at good 'ol Bucknell...which is why I am currently on LJ instead of doing my homework for 8:30. I hate it, I want it to go away. I am bored and I just Google Image searched "dreamboat" and this beautiful man showed up... It's gonna be an awesome day!

You are a

Social Liberal
(60% permissive)

and an...

Economic Liberal
(35% permissive)

You are best described as a:

Centrist



Link: The Politics Test on Ok Cupid

:x: Time = 12:38 p.m. :x: Name = Christy, clangsto :x: Tattoos= Yes, I heart it, and my dad still doesn't know about it...though I showed my mom this summer [on its 2-year birthday, as well!] :x: Piercings= I have one more than Rachel, who won a DVD player for having so many piercings...and I had a dream the other night of getting the next piercing on my list, so maybe an addition is eminent! Yay! :x: Height = 5'9" :x: Shoe size = 8 1/2 or 9 [if the shoe is narrow] :x: Hair color = brown? blonde? red? a lot of people have been saying red lately...? :x: Eye color = dark brown :x: Siblings = zero, only the ones I made up in my head :x: Status = "permanent resident" last I checked Last: :x: Movie you rented = "Dawn of the Dead"...it took 2 attempts for me to get through the whole thing, but was totally bleak/worth it! :x: Movie you last bought = "Remember the Titans" :x: CD you bought/burned = the new Audioslave :x: T.V. show you've watched = SportSCenter :x: Thing you bought = lunch & tea Do: :x: you wish you could live somewhere else? = other than the middle of nowhere? *gasp* SURELY NOT! :x: you have a crush on someone? = I think it's a permanent crush...oh, but I got a new intellectual crush the other day, it's so exciting :x: Others find you attractive = if so then they would have an odd way of showing it, haha [my parents tell me I'm pretty!] :x: you want more piercings = I'm always looking for a new one...it has been over a year since I got my last one...summer before junior year in the South Side with Rachel Bell :x: you like cleaning = two words: anal retentive. :x: you like roller coasters = YES! :x: You write cursive or print = a juxtoposition of both Do you believe in: :x: long distance relationship? I didn't used to believe in any sort of relationship...I am currently in the process of converting! :x: Driving drunk = Click it or ticket...always designate a DD...only you can prevent forest fires Have you: :x: Ever cried over a girl = puh-lease...you are talking to Ms. Emotion 2005 here, of course :x: Ever cried over a boy = mos' def. :x: Ever been lied to = yep :x: Ever been arrested = almoooost.....SEVEN-ELEVEN WILL FOREVER LIVE IN INFAMY! What: :x: Shampoo do you use = Pantene, Herbal Essences, Fructis, Thermasilk...on constant rotation :x: are you scared of = the dark [see Dirk's most recent post for obvious reasons] Number: :x: Of hearts I have broken? uncountable...I try to hit a daily quota of 8 :x: Of people I could trust with my life? three, maybe 4 :x: Of scars on my body? millions...chicken pox, accidents, heating-pad-burns, etc. :x: Of things in my past that I regret? I only regret committing the same mistakes over & over Do you think you are: :x: Funny = I try very hard to make people laugh :x: Loveable = I find that I am often times the lover and not the lovee :x: Caring = yurp :x: Dorky = unmatched in dorkiness Favorite: :x: 7 letter word = Chrisy [narcissism had too many "S"s] :x: Actor/Actress = Ashley Judd because she is classy, an AIDS ambassador in Africa, and married to a race-car driver! :x: Color(s) = red, white, brown, pink Person who last: :x: Saw you cry = Annie :x: Yelled at you = myself :x: Sent you an email = Professor Rickard :x: Hugged you = Annie :x: Said "I love you" to you = Chris Have you ever: :x: Kept a secret from everyone : I am undressing you with my eyes... :x: Cried during a movie = naturally :x: Planned your week by tv guide = nope :x: What time is it now? = 12:58 p.m. :x: Apples or bananas? = this shit is bananas...b a n a n a s [either with peanut butter] :x: Walmart or target? = TARGET! :x: Spring or Fall? = fall as time of the year, sweater weather, etc.; spring semester is better, tho :x: What are you gonna do after you finish this? = revamp my resumee...aka -- show off how frickin' awesome I am Last: :x: Noise you heard? = my computer likes to make squelch-y sounds at me, so that...and I just realized that I should have used "squelch" as my favorite 7-letter word rather than "narci[ss]i[s]m" :x: Smell you sniffed? = my lunch salad :x: Time you went out of state? = vacation to Florida :x: Do you believe in love at first sight? = nope :x: Do you want children one day & if so, how many? = sure, maybe...1? 2? :x: Most important thing to you in a true friendship is? = I like Abby's answer, it sums up friendship perfectly: "the person gives as much as i do. they love me when i'm moody, psycho, laughing too loudly, disgusting, spitting food accidentally, (menstruating, haha), hostile...everything. i can show every side of myself and tell the person anything. i have good friends." Other Info: :x: Criminal record? = no, Scotty took all of the blame...that beancounter will never entrust him to flame again :x: Do you speak any other languages? = pig latin! [just not around my mom because she freaks out] :x: Last book you read = Plato's "The Republic"...last non-schoolbook would have to be Jon Stewart's "America" :x: How old do you act? = about as old as I look...12 :x: Pets = zero...I can't wait to be on my own [w/o my parents] so I can get a puppy, though!!!!!!!!! :x: What makes you happy? = little things like my window-spider Harold & rekindling friendships with people I admire and respect...[plus the usual things, like friends, love, family, puppies] Have You Ever: :x: Thought you were going to die = affirmative :x: Wanted to Run away = likewise :x: Flunked a grade = oh, a whole grade? nope :x: Ran away = I try to run away from my problems all of the time :x: Skipped a grade = nope :x: Been in jail = nope :x: Contacted the police = when I was small by accident :x: Been in love = yes :x: Been suspended = nope :x: Stolen Anything = lip gloss when I was in 8th grade :x: Cheated On A Test = nope :x: Been In The Hospital = tons of times :x: Let a friend cry on your shoulder = I'm always available :x: Fell asleep in the bath = nope...scary! :x: Gone to Church = I need to do so more often :x: Been to camp = like sleep-away camp? do church retreats count? :x: Been in an earthquake = nope, thank goodness :x: Been in a tornado = likewise :x: Knew you were in love = duh. :x: Streaked in the streets = how boring...it would be way more fun on the quad :x: Screamed at someone you love = yep :x: Been attacked = by bugs? yep :x: Stayed on the phone for over 3 hours = hahaha, yep :x: What time is it now? 1:11 p.m.

I feel like I have lost my faith, almost...that's how integral politics have been to my life for the past 3.5 years. I don't know whether it's the inefficiency intrinsically bred into the system, or the black-and-white of the political parties; you aren't either right or wrong, just or immoral, Democrat or Republican, conservative or liberal, culturally relative or universally accepted. Why do I have to go through this all now? Is it because of DC? Will I ever be able to watch a movie without being distracted by the factualness of the American political system's portrayal? How do I know that there are absolutely no answers to any of my questions right now? I feel like I don't have the energy to really figure myself out internally to be able to fully express this junction I'm [not] exploring. I can't take a stance on any issue anymore because I see the benefits of both sides of argument; this also allows for me to see the GLARING FLAWS as well. I am in theoretical no-man's-land, which makes me glad that at least I am not a philosophy major: my life would be collapsing around me even more if that were the case. Why is it that as soon as the one area of my life that has thus far eluded me comes together, all the rest of me falls apart? Why can't I have it all work out at once? It almost makes me want to have things back to how I was used to them... almost. I would never willingly give that up.

I love being back at Bucknell a whoooole lot.  Gateway Sweet-Ass is just about as sweet-ass as it could ever be...Roser 2 all together is even better.  What a fun, wild, and interesting year we're going to have!

There is a huge motherfucking spider that lives outside of my bedroom window.  Tonight I watched it attack and coccoon some poor trapped bug; that was pretty sweet.  When it is daylight, however, s/he does not sit on the web.  I really would feel much more comfortable if I knew where s/he went during the daytime.  This makes me think of Mike's spider friends from last year.

I am frustrated because no matter where I am anymore I end up missing people from somewhere else...last semester all I ever did was "see" people from Bucknell" all over DC, and now so many people look like Washingtonians to me it's ridiculous.  Last night I had a great long talk with Brynnie on the phone catching up.  I need to send her birthday present pronto.

Being back on campus is making it more difficult for me to maintain my non-smoking ways.  I quit on the 11th of July, the physical need has long been dealt with; all that is left is the feeling of having a cigarette in my hand while walking across campus still seems so much more natural to me.  Plus, I am bored out of my mind and the only thing to do now is eat rather than smoke.  Help help help help.

Keeping a committed, invested, amazing relationship long-distance is so much more difficult than I remember it being.  There's a big ol' chunk of me missing all of the time, it seems.
I hate training people to do my job.  I am getting frustrated with lots of the new employees, too.  Ugh, I just don't like not having total control of everything!  Bah.

Not a great couple of days...

...EXCEPT for going to the Steeler game last night with my mommy.  That was freaking awesome.

I have the hobbies/interests of a man...except for I like other men, not women...does that make me gay?

Rest in Peace, Peter Jennings. :-[ He freaking ruled. Did you know that he didn't even graduate from high school? Or that he had married four times? Or that he was the baddest news motherfucker on the block? Sad sad sad... I've only been at work for an hour and already I am tired of being here. And working 'til 9 p.m. is making this day pass very slowly. I think this will be a 4-cuppa java day. I be's hoping that the idea of a 13-hour day is worse than the actual day. We had 11 people for 'yakking yesterday morning...although Annie dropped out and Scotty & Wilson & Jeannie slept in, we had Lang & me, Hickey & Cooter, Saxton & Mrs. Saxtonburg, Brandon & Ashley [groan!], and Joey, Jordan, and Ricky. It was an awesome turnout, and those kids are so cool sometimes!!!! Hickey was nice enough to bring a cooler of my leftover Rolling Rock from the night before, from which I promptly stuck as many bottles in my shorts pockets & stuffed my bikini top with them [the remainder are in my trunk]. The Saltsburg River & Trail guy is always SO STONED! It was 9 a.m. when we got there and he was already pretty blitzed, I can't believe how he keeps up with all the ganga he smokes! But I guess it makes for him not caring that two people are taking half a case of beer onto the river while accompanied by about 6 minors. Go us...Hickey and I are alcoholics! After about 5 paddle strokes Ashley started to complain, asking how much longer we'd be on the river. Ugh. [Allegedly, the only reason Brandon brought her was so that no one at the company picnic would be like "oh, KAYAKING!" and she didn't know about it...durrr.] And her complaining put Brandon in a pissy mood as usual, so I put as many paddle-lengths between them and me as possible [which wasn't very hard to do]. But, other than that, I LOVE that group. As usual, we just floated down the river laughing the whole way. It took us about 3-3 1/2 hours which is longer than usual, but we stopped for a VERY long time at the rope swing. It was so awesome and scary and fun...I went from almost as high as Jordan & Ricky were jumping from even after I fell off. [The first time was fun, I didn't jump from very high as I was pretty nervous, but the second time I went a lot further up the hillside. I guess I didn't have a good handle on the rope as, right at the bottom of my vector, my hands let go and I flew into the water at top speed. I was surprised that I didn't hit anything since it was so shallow, but I entered at an angle, so I guess that was in my favor. Everyone else thought I'd be dead & were really looking forward to telling my parents/their bosses about my tragic demise. But the next time I jumped from higher and had a better rope hold...it was glorious!] Lang & I decided that Cooter is probably the nicest, sweetest, most level-headed kid ever. We were doing imitations of him all day yesterday, and he just went with it and even expanded on them..."I'm comin', little buddy!" "Don't worry, Johhhhn, I'll catch you!" B & Ash were miserable as usual, even afterwards at the company picnic...ugh. Oh well, we're all just sick of Brandon putting himself through hell because he's afraid to be alone. Stupid sap. The picnic was great, though sparsely-attended. I don't know why people are beginning to refuse our company, but it looks really bad & ungrateful to your company managers who go through all of this effort for no one to show up. I was surprisingly lucky in that I won a raffle AND half of a 50/50...I haven't won anything since 6th grade lucky plate! We didn't have enough people to play a real game of baseball and most of us were so hungry that we ate ourselves into stomach aches...haha, we so totally rule. So that's the life of a young Langston Subaru employee; we freaking rule! I hope nobody read that whole thing because, dude, how boring!
^that is very Uncle-Sam-like, so I appologize, but it's for a good cause: PLEASE CLICK HERE TO "SIGN" AN ANTI-TORTURE PETITION. I was gonna pass this on AI's way, but the LJ way is so much easier.

I really want to work for Amnesty out of school.  Like a lot.

Who would've thought it'd begin with a teeeny IG report and turn into a career aspiration?

My ass hurts [from x-treme Weisner family volleyball].  Otherwise, it was a really fun time once I loosened up...me, shy?  Yes it's true.  I should have known that Lang's family would be great, though, as he's the best.  Now all I have to do is wait for Saturday to meet his brother and it'll be all taken care of.

I worked for 55 hours last week...great paycheck. Has anybody heard from Annie Barber since 3:00 p.m. yesterday? If you have, please call me ASAP, I am worried sick about her. Spending the night with Mr. Lang's extended maternal family=freaked out of my wits...wish me luck

your humor style:
CLEAN | COMPLEX | DARK


You like things edgy, subtle, and smart. I guess that means you're probably an intellectual, but don't take that to mean you're pretentious. You realize 'dumb' can be witty--after all isn't that the Simpsons' philosophy?--but rudeness for its own sake, 'gross-out' humor and most other things found in a fraternity leave you totally flat.

I guess you just have a more cerebral approach than most. You have the perfect mindset for a joke writer or staff writer. Your sense of humor takes the most effort to appreciate, but it's also the best, in my opinion.

Also, you probably loved the Office. If you don't know what I'm talking about, check it out here: http://www.bbc.co.uk/comedy/theoffice/.

I love Bill McConnel: high school French teacher, senior year advisor, Bucknell grad, DU alum, Langston Subaru customer...he is the best ever!

Two out of four people in my waiting room this morning were reading HP6; that made me a happy girl.  

Two dates, two viewings of "Charlie & the Chocolate Factory" [once in IMAX!], two of my favorite people: Mr. Lang and my momma.  Can't decide who I liked watching it with more...sorry to the b/f, but I think it was my mom.

Two months of summer are over, one of which having been blissfully boyfriended.

Two dinner dates with my Honey-Bee-Bizzy this week: last Sunday after the Bucko's game and tonight in GBG to get the A-OK from Dr. & Mrs. B. on my new bf.  Wish him luck.

Two nights until a totally chock-a-block full weekend of family-meeting.  Really nervous.

I don't think the phone has rung once since I've been at work today. People [customers] are obnoxious: -"Where's the coffee?!?" [sorry, I forgot to make it jackass...gimme 5 minutes] -some guy keeps staring at me from his perch behind Chris's desk [ick, sit in the waiting room please] -a guy with a fantastic mullet-ponytail asked me to turn on the tv, then started to BLAST the sound, then walked away from the tv lounge after about 10 minutes and hasn't been back [a different customer turned the volume back down, thank goodness] Some chick gave Chris major sass last night when I paid for our ice cream ["Why are you paying, he should!"], so we decided to mess with her. He is now a jobless leech, I'm helping him get back on his feet, and we're going to that ice cream place every Friday for the rest of the summer just to reinforce it. Plus they have good chocolate-/nut-dipped cones. Oh, that's a pretty blue.

I have been dead for a few days...at work for the time being because I just couldn't handle staying at home any longer.

Happy belated 21st birthday wishes to K-Thug & Stev.

WebMD is my hero.

My forehead is peeling...but that is truly the only place I got sunburned on vaca; a miracle! Nicoderm CQ is giving me It's so strange because I don't remember having dreamt at all at night for about the past year until being in Florida. Then, since starting "the patch" on Monday, I have had very strange dreams, the most recent being: I was working at the dealership in it's old location [it hasn't been there for almost 4 years now], and Cathy [my non-parental boss] came up and said I had a package. I got really excited because I thought it might be the Neighborhoodies order I am expecting [which is true], but it turned out to be a bunch of Subaru stickers and Langston business cards and license plates. Wasted Face and Fasano were in town [?!] and I had plans with them for 9 p.m., which I told my dad; he said that I couldn't go because I had a physical therapy appointment at 9 o'clock that night [again ?!]. I got really mad because my leg wasn't even being a problem [another truism] and threw the disappointing package of Subie propaganda into the air and it fell pell mell all over the dingy old showroom. After calling my orthopedist and cancelling my appointment, I stormed out the door. Once outside I was out by my home-base Metro station in DC; there was a HUGE picket/demonstration/movement happening with people shouting and carrying signs [like I saw in Dupont Circle the one day last semester]. I tried to ask the people what the gathering was in response to because I really wanted to join it, but no one was willing to tell me. Catty-corner from where I was [in a field that doesn't really exist], the Shady Side Academy field hockey team was practicing the same re-entry/turn-over drill over and over and over again. The only people I really recognized were Nikki Barraff [playing right midi of all positions; she used to play forward], Ally Shogan [center midi], Sarah Bidula [left forward], and Lindsay Tannenholtz [at right forward]. They kept hitting the ball into play from the right sideline and doing their passing/shooting thing, but somehow all of the balls found their way back out of play on the same part of the formation; they were all coming to rest next to the person on my left, standing watching the protest as well. This person was ignoring their presense, and I wanted so badly to reach over and throw them back [Shady Side field hockey players are always losing their balls, usually because of the cross country team] or ask him [her?] to please throw them back across the street, but I couldn't do either. The rest of the dream I don't really remember, just that it came and went as I drifted in and out of sleep. I woke up feeling unrested and really frustrated. My dad just came into work and I was yawning and he gave me some shit [playfully] about being out late last night [I got home from Lang's at 12], but really it's because I slept so restlessly. Haha, at least that's my story for him. I hate dreaming because I never could get that psychoanalytical reasoning of them; comments re: how screwed up my mind is are more than welcome! Tonight I'm taking off my nicotine patch BEFORE bed!

My week at Bitch Beach, aka Cocoa Beach, was awesome...I had so much fun with my mom, Sally, and Kathy.  That is what vaca should be like every time: wake up, beach, dolphins, [we saw a wedding on the beach one afternoon...watched the whole thing from our balcony], shopping, and bars.

I am so smitten...I was actually glad to start coming back to work in order to be with him.  Ugh, I'm a little crack-pot.

Not allowed to go back to the mall for the duration of the summer...also a spend-a-holic.

Pretty romantic weekend, this.  Spoon spoon spoon.  Let's see if I can maintain some normalcy and not freak out like usual; doubt it.

In other news:

I love Jimmy Buffett.  I love Rachel Bell.  I love my parents.  I love hippie-dancing in bikini & grass skirt.  I love people squirting you with water guns when you're hotter than hell and melting everywhere.

I hate inter-"family" drama.  I hate tinkering with arrangements that are proven to work.  I hate that we couldn't sell our extra tickets.  I hate the sweltering, swooning [in a bad way], collapse-inducing heat.

Am so tired right now; hangover nonexistant as did not drink very much [was too hot].  Cynthia made a really nasty-tasting pot of coffee this morning; it don' matta, it's sustenance.  I have no cigarettes nor food, though I am very much craving both at the moment.  Oh well, I have great memories to fulfil me.

"One Particular Harbour" is the best song ever written.  Well, maybe a bit of an overstatement.
One of my customers just performed M. Jackson's "Thriller" dance and J. Jackson's "Rhythm Nation" dance in front of my desk.  It was awesome.

I am leading a double life.

The Keys to Your Heart

You are attracted to good manners and elegance.
In love, you feel the most alive when your partner is patient and never willing to give up on you.
You'd like to your lover to think you are loyal and faithful... that you'll never change.
You would be forced to break up with someone who was ruthless, cold-blooded, and sarcastic.
Your ideal relationship is comforting. You crave a relationship where you always feel warmth and love.
Your risk of cheating is zero. You care about society and morality. You would never break a commitment.
You think of marriage as something that will confine you. You are afraid of marriage.
In this moment, you think of love as something you thirst for. You'll do anything for love, but you won't fall for it easily.
What Are The Keys To Your Heart?
